intro: Morinda boninensis, commonly known as the Bonin morinda, is a flowering plant native to the Bonin Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
